gregtech_modern.lv__low_voltage.quests66: &o&7This quest's subject is optional, but may still be of interest to you. We've put it here in the name of completeness.&r

The &3World Accelerator&r... well, accelerates the world. Placing it down and powering it will cause it to tick-accelerate any Tile Entities around it. Using a Screwdriver, you can also toggle it to tick-accelerate random blocks in its area, such as farmland.

Keep in mind that GregTech machines are blacklisted from tick acceleration - this is for the better, as tick-accelerating a GregTech machine can lead to it consuming many Amps at once and nuking your power system.
gregtech_modern.lv__low_voltage.quests67: If you're a builder, &bweep no more&r - this custom multiblock, freshly made with the powers of &dKubeJS&r, is made for you.
By providing the multiblock with a near-negligible amount of &6Construction Foam&r, you'll gain access to increased yields of many different &bbuilding blocks&r to spice up your base.
If you build it, they will come
gregtech_modern.lv__low_voltage.quests68: &9Drills&r are electric tools which come in different tiers. The &7LV&r Drill is quite good: mining a 3x3x1 area. Higher-tier drills can mine 3x3x3, 5x5x5, and up to 9x9x9 to make huge holes!
This suggested drill is with a Diamond tip, which might be the best material for it right now.
&9Note 1:&r All Electric Tools have a lot more durability than indicated, as they use Energy to prevent damage from being applied! On top of that, they can be enchanted as Pickaxes can.
&9Note 2:&r Drills can now be configured to different ranges, not just the maximum or a single block.
&l&3Lore:&r&o Up until GTCEu, Electric tools required Stainless Steel, which locked players out of experiencing their glory until &6HV&f!
We Drill Now? We Drill Now.
gregtech_modern.lv__low_voltage.quests69: &o&7This quest's subject is optional, but may still be of interest to you. We've put it here in the name of completeness.&r

The &3Block Breaker&r... well, we'll &dleave it to you&r to figure out what this one does. There are likely some &anifty farms&r you can create with clever usage of this machine - especially with the &6many vanilla mechanics&r introduced between 1.12.2 and 1.20.1!
Higher tiers of &3Block Breaker&r come with an additional speed bonus.
&eAny&r Block Breaker will complete this Quest.
I've had it with these blocks!
gregtech_modern.lv__low_voltage.quests70: &o&7This quest's subject is optional, but may still be of interest to you. We've put it here in the name of completeness.&r
&3Item Collectors&r will pick up items - similar to any kind of &aVacuum Chest&r you may be familiar with from &dother mods&r.

Higher tiers of &3Collector&r will increase the &ecollection radius&r over multiple chunks. This can be useful if your farm relies on in-world drops, such as &bSugar Cane&r, or... &7uh, bizarrely,&r &8chicken eggs.&r
&eAny&r Item Collector will complete this Quest.
gregtech_modern.lv__low_voltage.quests71: A feature of the &5Soft Mallet&r that you may be aware of is its ability to &6pause machines&r. However, did you know that if you &bsneak whilst pausing a machine&r, it'll tell the machine to continue operating until it finishes its recipe?
This is &2perfect&r if you need to make changes to a multiblock but don't want to &evoid items&r, as unforming a multiblock will void all inputs.
gregtech_modern.lv__low_voltage.quests72: This is a &4meme&r quest - check the recipe requirement for the teddy.
Yes... this will take you an entire year to craft in an &7LV&r Compressor. How long would this take you to craft when overclocked to the highest possible value?
&7Definitely don't worry about making this now... take the hint and wait for a heavy overclock.
&l&3Lore:&r&o The main developer of this pack spent far too long fixing the model files to customise this thing.&7.&8. If you're wondering why there's a random Pokemon doll, it's my Minecraft skin!
Got enough time on your hands?
And they say GregTech is grindy...
gregtech_modern.lv__low_voltage.subtitle: Tame electricity and make your first machines
gregtech_modern.lv__low_voltage.title: &7LV&r - Low Voltage
gregtech_modern.multiblock_dilemma.subti: A handy reference of all the multiblocks
gregtech_modern.multiblock_dilemma.title: Multiblock Dilemma
gregtech_modern.mv__medium_voltage.quest: The &3Pyrolyse Oven&r is an electric equivalent to the &3Coke Oven&r. It can produce &9Coal Coke&r and &9Charcoal&r with a &9Creosote&r byproduct just as before, but also has additional &6Organic Byproducts&r, the most beneficial of these being &aWood Tar&r.
Another product is &aBiomass&r, which is more pertinent for your progression as of this moment.
The byproducts can be Distilled for an array of organic resources, with &odifferent&r byproducts giving &odifferent&r ratios of &odifferent&r chemicals.
You will need to take a peek at the &9Distillation&r Quest to get to grips with the power of distillation...
There are recipes that can accept &bNitrogen&r to double the speed. This isn't quite worth pursuing right now, but Nitrogen will eventually be free and infinite.

You should be more than fine with a single &3LV Energy Hatch&r, and Superconductors to supply a steady &d64 EU/t&r. Additionally, &3Cupronickel Coils&r are perfect when you're getting used to the Pyrolyse Oven, but you may want to upgrade to &bKanthal&r eventually.
&9&lNote:&r&l The Plant path is one path you can take towards &9&lEthylene&r&l, which is a necessary chemical in progressing to &6HV&r&l. The other path involves Oil.&r
The Pyrolyse Oven remains &doptional&r. However, it is very rewarding to construct one either for Power, or for the various Byproducts, and we highly recommend you give it a look.

&l&3Lore:&r&o In GT5u, the structure for the Pyrolyse Oven was infamously a giant box with only 9 coils inside. Players usually spent several minutes debugging what is wrong due to a lack of a EMI preview.
Thermal Decomposition
Pyrolyse Oven
Welcome to the &2natural&r Ethylene route! This method uses &9plant matter&r to produce Ethanol.
Before we get ahead of ourselves, &aSugar Cane&r works fine in a &3Brewery&r for a decent yield of Biomass.
Othe&rrwise, you could try the \"&o&dPlantball into Bio Chaff&r\" route, and then turn it into Biomass, either in the &3Brewery&r or the &3Pyrolyse Oven&r - the latter being more efficient.
&9Note:&r Only one Bio Chaff can be obtained from maceration until you make the &3HV Macerator&r.

&l&3Lore:&r&o You may recognise Plantballs from IndustrialCraft2! In IC2 Experimental, there was this rather... obscure way to turn Biomass into Biogas for power, which sadly required too much investment to be really worth it.
Plants aren't industrial enough!
Biomass

The Brewery can be used to make &aLubricant&r from &aRedstone&r and &aCreosote&r/&aOil&r. Lubricant has some niche uses, namely being used in the &3Cutter&r to significantly reduce the duration of its recipes.

The Brewery is a very, very slow machine, but it requires almost no power to run its recipes. Building &2many Breweries&r will help you obtain enough Biomass on your quest for plastic. Oh, and you can use it to brew &dPotions&r too!
&9Note:&r The Brewery \"unlocks\" the Biomass path towards &9Ethylene&r. The same can be done in the &3Pyrolyse Oven&r. The other path involves Oil.&r
&l&3Lore:&r&o You could make your own Brewery if you want to build up a company and start selling Booze... in GregTech 6.&r
*hic*... *hic*
Local Brewery selling Booze
Our warmest congratulations on making it here.
The way you should obtain &aEthylene&r was described in the previous Quest, depending on the route you chose.
&aEthylene&r will shortly be used in polymer production. It's also useful in a few other reactions.
One of many hydrocarbons
Ethylene
Put your previously made &aBiomass&r into a &3MV Distillery&r to make &aEthanol&r.
You will need this for &dEthylene&r by reacting it with &aSulfuric Acid&r in a &3MV Chemical Reactor&r... unless you chose to go down the Oil path.
Once you have a hefty starting stock of Ethanol, consider making and distilling &9Fermented Biomass&r in a &3Distillation Tower&r (when you get there!) for extra chemicals.
&cDo not try&r to use Ethanol as a Power source... it's quite possibly its worst use. If it's organic &9Power&r that you want, we suggest taking a look at &dBenzene&r instead!
Yo, wait - that's alcohol!
Ethanol
Distillating &aOil&r will give you Fuel that you will need to desulfurize.
&aHydrogen Sulfide&r is perfectly &drecycled&r in an &3Electrolyzer&r.
To automate this process, simply place your &3Chemical Reactor&r and your &3Electrolyzer&r next to each other. Be sure to use your &5Screwdriver&r to &4enable input from the output side&r.
&aNaphtha&r is a good &9Product&r source. Keep following the quests to the right for more details.
We're still confused on how this is pronounced
Naphtha
Don't panic! We'll mostly be doing this to get hydrocarbons.
There are many ways to acquire &dEthylene&r from Oil processing. It's easy to get lost in all the options and recipes!
The best way is to steam-crack &aNaphtha&r in a &3Chemical Reactor&r. Be sure to make the &aSeverely Steam-Cracked&r version for a higher yield of Ethylene.
Once in &6HV&r, you'll have the option to do this recipe in the &3Cracking Unit&r at 100%% efficiency. Unfortunately, the recipes you are doing with the Chemical Reactor have a loss of &450%%&r.

&9Note:&r All of this looks and feels terribly inefficient - we hope that's strong motivation to tier up! The &3Distillation Tower&r will be a huge upgrade for petrochem, but you're not quite there... yet. Right now, you'll have to use a &3Distillery&r to get &dEthylene&r.
Fuel and oil cracking can get complicated...
Fuel Cracking

Higher-tier Generators will increase their fuel consumption proportionally to their Generation rate, keeping the duration of fuels and the specific amount of energy from fuels the same. The &3Advanced Steam Turbine&r will use &d5,120 mB Steam&r per second, equivalent to &d256 mB/t&r.
Get &eany&r of the generators to complete this quest, but you may prefer starting off with the &3Advanced Steam Turbine&r.
There are a few new power options available for &bMV&r. Selecting the Generators and pressing &4U&r will let you see which fuels count as &aCombustion&r or &aGas&r.
Quests in the top left corner of this Chapter are for the valuable Power options.
If you stick to &9Steam&r for your Power generation, you'll probably need a &3Large Boiler&r.
Things are 'boutta get rough
MV Generators
Electricity Generation in MV
Any Steel you encounter in day-to-day life is most likely &7Stainless Steel&r. It is extremely resilient against corrosion.&r
Stainless Steel is the material for &6HV&r components, like Aluminium for &bMV&r and Steel for &7LV&r. It is also used in high quantities for the &3Distillation Tower&r.
It requires &cChromium&r, obtained mainly from &cRuby&r, and &2Manganese&r, obtained from &2Pyrolusite&r and others in its vein.
Smelting Stainless Steel requires &dHV Power&r, which you likely do not have at this point. Scaling Power Production is crucial.
If you &9haven't already&r, it would be a good idea to get a second EBF going. They can share blocks, so that means your second EBF only requires &a10 Cupronickel Coils&r instead of 16.
Have one EBF run off &bMV&r for Aluminium and any other recipes requiring &bMV&r Power, and one running off &6HV&r with &32 MV Energy Hatches&r.
HV is in your grasp
Stainless Steel
&3Transformers&r allow you to step up and down safely between Voltage tiers. They convert the power they receive into an equivalent amount of power 1 voltage tier above or below the input voltage.

Apart from running machines on different voltage tiers, Transformers come in handy for transporting power across longer distances, as cable loss has less of an effect at higher voltages. Just like real life!
Transformers have 5 low voltage sides, and 1 high voltage side.
The &9normal&r Transformer can only do 1A <-> 4A conversion, but &9Adjustable&r Transformers can be changed between 1A <-> 4A, 2A <-> 8A, 4A <-> 16A, and 16A <-> 64A conversions.
Use a &aSoft Hammer&r to change between transforming up and down, and a &aScrewdriver&r on Adjustable Transformers to change the amperage.
Higher tier Transformers will require &9Coils&r.
LV In Disguise
Transformers
If you're wanting to dive into &bMV&r, start here.
The dusts created in an &3MV Mixer&r have great utility.
Mixing more complex alloys
Advanced Mixer
Here's a list of the components you will need in &bMV&r. To alleviate the pain, be sure to autocraft or &dbulk-craft&r these parts, especially &aMotors&r.
Familiar with the &aEmitter&r? This tier's Emitter requires a &dFlawless Emerald&r in its recipe, which'll be only attainable with the &3Sifting Machine&r for now.
Conveyors, Pumps and Robot Arms are objective upgrades to &7LV&r versions if you use them as covers.
&6This quest unlocks a new tutorial on Overclocking in the &lTips and Tricks&r&6 tab - check it out to learn more!&r
Hated crafting these in the previous tier?
MV Components
The Advanced Electrolyzer allows you to decompose &6far more&r Dusts. This will make getting materials such as &aAluminium&r&o a lot&r easier!
We made it to MV, and, well...
Advanced Electrolyser
All four output Dusts obtained from Clay electrolysis are immensely useful.
We'll ask you to give us a total of &a416 Clay Dust&r for this quest. You may also want to look into other sources of similar materials, such as &aSodalite&r. Check EMI for some ideas.
You should use the Sodium and/or Lithium to make some &6MV Batteries&r.
Grr, all this useless &dWater&r you're getting keeps clogging the machine! Maybe you should deal with it by using a &3Voiding Cover&r.
Clay is an extremely &mbalanced&r useful material for electrolysis
A Balanced Quest
This kind soul&r will mine ores for you when placed above a vein.
Vertical range is unlimited below the miner. Horizontal range is displayed in the tooltip.
The &bMV&r variant may not have the range to mine a full vein, but the &6HV&r variant does, so you may wish hold off for now. Get &eeither&r to complete this Quest.
You will need &9Power&r. &aCharged Batteries&r may work, but they tend to run out of power, which is a bit inconvenient.
Our top suggestion is to use a filled &3Drum&r of some kind of fuel &7(if you're using Steam, no dice!)&r and a &3Generator&r.
Place the Drum above your Generator and right-click it with a &5Screwdriver&r to auto-output into the Generator.

&cNote:&r Do not forget to &dchunkload&r all 9 chunks of the ore vein with FTB Utilities &7(open the map in the top left corner, claim the chunks with left-click, and enable force loading with shift-left-click)&r.
&9Tip:&r You can either use an &3ME Chest&r or a &32x2 Drawer&r as the output inventory to make transporting the ores back home a simple task. The &3ME Chest&r can be powered with EU directly.
Any of the listed Miners
Digital Miner

Vanadiumsteel is required in small quantities in progression. It's &6nearly four times as durable&r as Steel if used in GregTech tools. The Vanadium comes from &aVanadium Magnetite&r, which you may have encountered in Magnetite veins.
Other Steel alloys include Blue Steel, Red Steel, and Black Steel!
Take some Blue Steel free of charge - it's twice as durable as Steel.
Steel Your Heart
Steel Alloys
&3Molecular Assemblers&r can be used to automate Crafting Table recipes, which means you can automate just about anything now.
To maximise the number of recipes a single Molecular Assembler can do, make a 3D matrix of Molecular Assemblers and ME Interfaces - where each component is surrounded on 6 sides by the other.
Using higher-tier materials in crafting will yield more Molecular Assemblers.

&cWarning:&r Try to avoid using GT tools in AE2 autocrafting! It causes AE2 to freak out... you may or may not destroy the TPS, or even worse, end up having thousands of tools being crafted as soon as one of them breaks.

If you're stubborn enough to &oreally&r want to use GT tools in AE2 autocrafting, prioritise encoding recipes that use tools with high durability, but &4do not&r setup autocrafting for the tools themselves. Instead, use the alternate &3Assembling Machine&r recipes.
Autocrafting at last!
Autocrafting

Making &aAE2 Presses&r will unlock all the &9Processors&r from AE2. This opens up &9ME Drives&r, &9ME Interfaces,&r &9ME Crafting CPUs&r... that's almost the rest of AE2 at your fingertips! &7(Or at least... not until you obtain Silicon Ingots.)&r
AE2 &9Printed Circuits&r are now made in the &3Forming Press&r.
Who likes meteor hunting, anyway?
Pressing Matters
The &3MV Cutter&r is required to cut &7Silicon Boules&r to prepare them for &aLaser Engraving&r.
We recommend you supply this machine with a steady stream of &dLubricant&r to cut down on the processing time.
Lubricant can be &3brewed&r from &eOil&r and &aTalc&r, &2Soapstone&r or &cRedstone&r.
Upgrades, people, upgrades!
Advanced Cutter

The &3Laser Engraver&r engraves patterns into &9Silicon Wafers&r based on the type of &9Lens&r it is given. After the wafers are engraved, they must be passed through a &3Cutting Machine&r to turn them into components ready to be put into Circuits.
Higher tier Engravers can etch more complex wafers for more efficient Circuits.
Laser Engraving
A &7LV&r Battery Buffer and two &7LV&r Energy Hatches likely won't cut it anymore. Let's remedy that!
Upgrade your Electric Blast Furnace with a &3MV Energy Hatch&r. Now, you can run it with &bMV&r Generators without having to mess around with &3Transformers&r.
LV is so old-school!
Upgrade your EBF!

The &3Assembler&r is a staple for every Tier; an important goal to unlock more recipes and progress further into the Age. Many in the community see crafting a voltage tier's Assembler as a sign of &oproperly&r reaching said voltage.
That being said, welcome to &bMV&r!
The &bMV &3Assembler&r unlocks &eTransistors&r, &eCapacitors&r and &eInductors&r, used for the next tiers of Circuits.
Assengers, Avemble
Advanced Assembler
GregTech doesn't provide ways to farm plants or trees, so we made a custom multiblock for the modpack!
The multiblock &3Greenhouse&r will be your source of &aWood&r and other plants if you wish.
Its &aWood&r production should be enough to run &32 Pyrolyse Ovens&r at their lowest Power.
You can also use this for automated &aResin&r. The yields are kept low to incentivize other rubber sources later in the game.
&9Note: &rWith &d40 EU/t&r recipes, it needs either 1 &bMV&r energy hatch or 2 &7LV&r energy hatches. Multiblocks will &cnot&r use 2A of one tier to reach the next one for recipe voltage minimums.
In other words, the controller needs to say at least \"&bMV&r\" in the GUI to run recipes which say \"&bMV&r\" in EMI, even if they can draw enough EU/t with a lower tier hatch configuration.
&9Note:&r The structure requires a lot of &9Wrought Iron&r. Make sure you have an &3Arc Furnace&r for that.

&l&3Lore:&r&o We originally implemented a Chemical Reactor recipe for wood in the modpack to solve the tree problem. Our implementation turned out to be completely busted, so we decided that a rebalance was due. Hopefully, the Greenhouse is a happy middle ground.
The power of KubeJS
Greenhouse

&3Kanthal Heating Coils&r are the next major step in progression. They increase the temperature of your &3Blast Furnace&r to &d2,700K&r, allowing you to process new materials. They may also &eaccelerate&r less hot recipes - check the quest to the top-left for details.

You will need a staggering &a128 Ingots&r for a full set of Coils, which will easily take over an hour. We advise that you move on to other projects while your &3EBF&r is hard at work - that or build another one!
An &3MV Chemical Bath&r is required to cool &cHot Ingots&r down. They're &chot&r when held, as the name implies. &o&7Maybe you should save your hands and automate this...&r
With the construction of a &3Kanthal EBF&r, you're now able to make &dSilicon Ingots&r, opening up the vast majority of AE2!
Is it getting hot in here?
Kanthal Coils
This is a guide on how to automatically route &lall&r your Hot Ingots to your Chemical Bath, while keeping everything automated in tip-top shape.
The cheap way would be to use filters, and manually add Hot Ingots one by one... which is so boring! Let's try the fun option.
Install an &aItem Tag Filter&r Cover on the side of your &3Chemical Bath&r, open it and set it to whitelist \"&e&lhot_ingots&r\".
From here, you can route with &9any logistics system&r of your choice.
Connect the output of your &3EBF(s)&r to the input of your &3Chemical Bath&r and the output dump (Chest or Crate).
You can also have a &dRestrictive Pipe&r in front of the output dump to ensure the Chemical Bath will be prioritized.

&l&9Note:&r If you wish to know more tags for more automation setups, they will display if you press Shift when hovering over an item. For instance, an item tagged with &e&o#forge:plates/copper&r would be filtered as &e&lplates/copper&r.
&9Other Note:&r The Item Tag Filter partially supports &dregex&r. Hover over the info icon for more information.
Stop burning your darn hands!
250IQ
A circuit component that you can now produce thanks to the &3MV Assembler&r and your shiny new &3Kanthal EBF&r.
Moore's Law
Alright... technically, obtaining &6HV&r Circuits and Stainless Steel lets you progress to &6HV&r - but let's not rush things.
The first thing you should make with these is a &3MV Circuit Assembler&r to unlock the new tier of Circuits right away; cheaper recipes is the &dreal payoff&r here.
...but hold on before getting too giddy
First HV Circuits!
&aRandom Access Memory&r is required for more advanced Electronic Components.
Random Access Memories
Download more RAM
The Integrated Logic Circuit is an alternate &7LV &aCircuit&r, which is easier to mass-produce, and can be upgraded to &bMV&r (and then &6HV&r).

&9Note:&r This is not a strict upgrade to the cost of Circuits - you would need to get to the next Tier for that, just slightly further down in &bMV&r. It is still an important upgrade, and is required to get to &6HV circuits&r.
&l&3Lore:&r&o The circuit progression in GTCEu is mostly based on GT5u's progression. It has been rebalanced to not be as painful. &lSpecifically&r&o this circuit tier, which was a trap!
You have unlocked a new tier of Circuits!
More LV Circuits
The &bMV&r Circuit for the Integrated Tier.
More... I demand more!
More MV Circuits
&9Silicon Boules&r are made in the &3EBF&r with half a stack of &aSilicon Dust&r and a pinch of &aGallium Arsenide&r. Their primary purpose is engraving &6Circuit Wafers&r.
After making the Boule, process it in the &3Cutter&r to get 16 Silicon Wafers ready for engraving.
The recommended &aSilicon&r source at this point would be... hm, either &dGlass Dust&r or &dSodalite&r.
&cWarning:&r Each Silicon Boule takes &47.5 minutes&r to make at 120 EU/t, or 1,080,000 EU! If the EBF loses power midway, the recipe will start to &close progress&r.
With that being said, Silicon Boules take an absolute age to craft, so consider parallelizing the recipe in multiple &3EBF&rs and stockpiling them.
These wafers are fully fungible
Silicon Lottery
As is common for every tier, the &3Circuit Assembler&r is an essential part of progression, always opening up a new Tier of circuits.
At this point you should be placing an &3Extractor&r next to your Circuit Assembler. Send off dozens of stacks of &aSoldering Alloy&r Ingots, and you won't have to worry about refilling again.
Yippee, yahoo
Advanced Circuit Assembler
At its lowest power (Cupronickel coils and &7LV&r Voltage), the &dMulti Smelter&r smelts 32 items in just 12 seconds - equivalent to &926.7 Furnaces&r, or 3.3 Steam Ovens!
If that wasn't already enough to convince you, standard &aoverclocks&r can be applied with sufficient voltage.
And even better - higher tier &3Coils&r increase the amount of items it can smelt in &dparallel&r!
Possibly the most powerful furnace you've seen
Ultimate Smelter
&6The best LV Circuits&r! You can start to churn these guys out, as you'll be making them for the rest of the game.
Try to keep a stockpile of these crafted at all times - making these on-demand can take a while.
Reaching &5EV&r will unlock methods to make them even cheaper.
It Feels Good to be the Best
Best LV Circuits
&6The best MV Circuits&r! You will be making these for the remainder of the game.
Eventually (in &9IV&r), they will become even cheaper.
MV has peaked
Best MV Circuits

Your first &5EV&r Circuit gets a unique texture. If you still consider yourself to be in &bMV&r, &ahold off&r on making too many of these, as they won't benefit you right now. We can't stop you from making these if you &djust wanna flex&r on us, though.
It'll be needed in &6HV&r.
Standing out amongst the rest
First EV Circuits!
Better &6HV&r Circuits - much &dcheaper&r and easier to make than before.
You should now be &aready to move on&r to the HV Chapter, unless you're yet to scale up your Power Production.
On that HV grind
More HV Circuits
A circuit component that you can now produce thanks to the &3MV Assembler&r!
Capacitors are commonly used in computers to store information during power failures, amongst many other uses.
No cap, bussin frfr
Capacitors
&aBlue Alloy&r is an excellent Cable material for &6HV&r power.
Nothing is preventing you from using it for &bMV&r power too! Make sure that you don't overvolt your machines, though.
Superconductors for both &bMV&r and &6HV&r are unlocked... later.
&aElectrotine&r is obtained from the &cNether&r, so don't craft it in the Mixer!
Furthermore, &aElectrotine&r can be separated for &dElectrum&r and &dRedstone&r.
You're blue now... that's my alloy
Blue Alloy
A Circuit Component that you can now make thanks to the &3MV Assembler&r.
If you want the cheapest recipe, &aNickel-Zinc Ferrite&r is the way to go.
Z = jwL
Inductors
If you want to be less fancy, just call it plastic.
For the polymerization process, add &aOxygen&r, which gives better returns than Air, then solidify like you would with Rubber.
&aPolyethylene (PE)&r is the key to unlocking &6many new things&r. It's commonly used as &dSheets&r, or in &dFluid&r form.
&l&3Lore:&r&o The OreDict and fluid name for Polyethylene in 1.12.2 GTCEu was &bplastic&f, for cross-mod compatibility.
Baby's first polymer!
Polyethylene
&aPatterns&r are used for AE2 autocrafting. Using &aPolyvinyl Chloride&r increases the yield by &64 times&r, and higher-tier plastics have even greater yields.
&3Molecular Assemblers&r aren't available for a little while more, but you can still automate machines with &9ME Interfaces&r.

A sub-note for autocrafting... whilst it's possible to perform chemical chains on-demand with AE2, doing so can build some bad habits that'll come back around to bite you in higher tiers. We urge you to passive things wherever you can.
Autocrafting at last!
Patterns
No, but seriously.
This is the &cu&6l&et&ai&bm&9a&5t&4e&r portable Fluid storage solution. &64,000 buckets of storage&r - in one single block!
Like Drums, Super Tanks &6keep their fluids when broken&r, and can be cleared in the crafting grid.
If you hunger for &9even more&r storage, take a look at higher tier Super Tanks or AE2 Fluid Storage Cells.
Super Tanks are OP!
Super Tank

&aPolyvinyl Chloride (PVC)&r is the 3rd-most produced plastic in real life. Here in CEu, it can be substituted for Polyethylene in the production of &aPlastic Circuit Boards&r and other items to increase the yield. It is required from &5EV&r onwards to wrap Cables.
PVC item pipes also have the &6highest throughput&r available for a while, but most of your setups right now won't need such speed. Still, it's good to keep this knowledge in your pocket.
&9Pro tip:&r The fluid form of PVC is never used in base GTCEu, so feel free to solidify all of it into sheets.
You've already made one polymer, what's two?
Polyvinyl Chloride
At this point, you have all the tools available to start making Plastic Boards. Higher-tier polymers in future will increase your PCB yields substantially.
The recipe chains are starting to get pretty long, so we recommend processing large batches in two dedicated &3Chemical Reactors&r.
It's a Casio on a Plastic Board
Plastic Boards
&aSodium Persulfate&r can be used in &9Ore Processing&r in the &3Chemical Bath&r to get various bonus outputs you would not normally obtain. It's completely optional, but pretty rewarding.
&lWait, stop! That's only a distraction&r - the real topic of this Quest is...
&aSodium Persulfate&r and &aIron III Chloride&r are used to make cheaper &9Good Circuit Boards&r, as their inclusion cuts Silver usage by a factor of four.
They're also &drequired&r to make &9Plastic Circuit Boards&r.

Making &aSodium Persulfate&r will yield &aHydrochloric Acid&r as a coproduct, which you may re-use to make &aIron III Chloride&r. This should the best approach right now, but the decision is entirely yours.
With more automation later in the game, Iron III Chloride will be the cheaper and more straight forward path.
This Quest requires &eboth&r Fluids to complete. You'll need both anyway...
Let's etch some Copper off Circuit Boards!
Sodium Persulfate / Iron III Chloride
EMI might look a little overwhelming here, so we'll go through the best path for Sulfuric Acid here.
Making &eSulfuric Acid&r is a three step process. It is used in many important reactions, so you should automate its production ASAP.

To automate it, you will need &3three LV Chemical Reactors&r. We would recommend building a dedicated setup somewhere with &3a single LV Generator&r to power all three machines. You can then spaghetti your pipes to handle input and output &m...or simply use AE2&r.
&9-&r Step 1: React &aSulfur&r with &bOxygen&r to form &aSulfur Dioxide&r.
&9-&r Step 2: React &aSulfur Dioxide&r with more &bOxygen&r to form &aSulfur Trioxide&r.
&9-&r Step 3: React &aSulfur Trioxide&r with &bWater&r to form &eSulfuric Acid&r.

&l&3Lore:&r&o GregTech 5's Chemical Reactor only had one Fluid slot. To circumvent that, they would do &dcell chemistry&f. The way you would automate Sulfuric Acid was by having one cell travel from machine to machine and then loop back to its starting position. A somewhat fun and interesting automation challenge, but also a chore!
\"...what he thought was H2O was H2SO4!\"
Sulfuric Acid
Obtain &9Hydrochloric Acid&r by mixing &aHydrogen&r and &aChlorine&r.
This acid is also obtained as waste from a lot of reactions involving &aChlorine&r. Depending on your setups, you may never need to produce it directly.
&cNote:&r We have a $medicine command on our Discord:
\"&b&oDo not attempt this in real life - it is not only illegal, but also stupidly dangerous&r\".
This applies to toying with chemicals. Please don't do it.
Side note - we can guarantee you have a sample of this with you right now! It's in your stomach as a part of gastric acid.
You'll need a lot of this!
Hydrochloric Acid
You may notice that some fluids say they are \"&aAcidic&r\", with &9Sulfuric Acid&r being one of them.
This means that many fluid pipes will not be able to transport them safely!
At &bMV&r, the cheapest pipes for acid transportation are probably &aGold&r, with the more expensive &aVanadium Steel&r or &aChrome&r pipes taking second and third place.
&aStainless Steel&r or &aPolytetrafluoroethylene&r (try saying that fast) will be valid options once you are in &6HV&r.

You have three options for acid storage at around this point: &dGlass Vials&r, &dGold Drums&r, or &dSuper Tanks&r. Glass Vials are like &9Fluid Cells&r, and are made to store acids. Gold Drums are self-explanatory. Super Tanks will be unlocked after &9Polyethylene&r, and can store any fluid without restriction.
&cWARNING:&r Acids in the wrong pipes will cause &cvoiding&r, &cpipe burning&r, and high chance of &cdeath&r! Be careful!
&l&3Lore:&r&o The acid transportation and storage mechanics originate from GregTech 6.
...if you don't read this quest.
I'm an acid professional, don't worry
It will Melt Your Flesh
&bMV&r Batteries will appeal to you if you want to buffer Energy, just like &7LV&r.
The cost in &aSodium&r, &aLithium&r or &aCadmium&r jumps up to 8 dusts, so you should use whatever you have the most of. The difference in capacity isn't &7THAT&r huge, after all!
Get &eeither&r Battery to complete the Quest.
Baby Got Battery
Any MV Battery
Better Batteries
We &lSINCERELY&r hope at &cno&r point you made the &7LV&r Extruder, because only the &bMV&r Extruder is actually useful. If you did, immediately &arecycle it&r through the Arc Furnace.
The Extruder shapes solid materials into (almost!) any form using &aIngots&r. This is a great way to reduce the amount of microcrafting, as well as keeping a high conversion ratio.
The Extruder can make &6Bolts&r, &6&6Small Gears&r, &6Gears&r, and &6&6Rings&r at the highest efficiency in a single step!
You may also like to use it for &dPipes&r, &dLong Rods&r, and &dRotors&r.
The biggest upgrade you'll make
Advanced Extruder
Aluminium Cells are a big upgrade over the Steel Cells or Universal Fluid Cells.
They can hold any fraction of Fluid - up to &d32 buckets&r!
Like cells... only larger!
Large Cells
It's quite the investment to own a &3Fluid Drilling Rig&r, but it is &oby far&r the most prominent &6source of Oil&r.
It pumps fluids from underneath Bedrock itself. Note that the fluids aren't actually there, instead being simulated.
Fluid veins are stored within &cchunk-sized regions&r. Each vein has a different fluid, but they are mostly types of Oil.
You can't carry out prospecting for fluid veins &oyet&r - this will come at &6HV&r.
Each vein generates with a different base yield. This is typically between &d150L&r to &d300L per second&r.
When drained, fluid veins will slowly deplete. This will cause the fluid yield to decrease over time until it reaches its depletion yield. At that point, you should move the Rig to a different vein.

A &3Basic Fluid Drilling Rig&r will last for 100,000 operations (with 1 second per operation) until depletion. This is enough for &6well over 10,000&r buckets of Oil. Higher tier Rigs will massively increase the yield, while also decreasing the depletion rate.
&lWhat you can find in the &2Overworld&r&l:&r
&9Oil:&r richer in &aLight Fuel&r, the most appreciated variant.
&9Light Oil:&r richer in &aRefinery Gas&r, usable for power.
&9Heavy Oil:&r richer in &aHeavy Fuel&r, which has uses that are more niche.
&9Raw Oil:&r richer in &aNaphtha&r, the best source of the early-game oil products.
&9Natural Gas:&r grants &aRefinery Gas&r with no distillation required.
&l&9Salt Water:&r grants &aSodium&r and &aChlorine&r, useful later.
&lWhat you can find in the &cNether&r&l:&r
&9Natural Gas:&r grants &aRefinery Gas&r but with higher yield than the Overworld vein.
&9Lava:&r hopefully, you know what this is.
When starting out, you may have to tap randomly until you find something you like. Remember that whatever you pump could also be used to refuel your Fluid Rig.
Fluid Drilling Rigs in CEu!
Fluid Drilling Rigs
Get any kind of &3Pump&r, place it above an Oil spout and... give it some power.
Do &cnot&r pump above an Ocean, as the pump will attempt to pull water, resulting in getting the pump stuck. Sorry!

Each Oil deposit can have between &63,000&r and &69,200&r buckets of Oil, which is a LOT! Refining the Oil&r onsite into either &aLight Fuel&r or &aDiesel&r (or both) is perfectly viable. The next few Quests will explain each type's pros and cons.
Store any obtained Oil in &3Drums&r, but you would do yourself a favour to use a &3Super Tank&r as soon as you can make them.
&cWarning: &rDo not forget to &dchunkload&r with FTB Utilities (open the map in the top left corner, claim the chunks with left-click, and enable force loading with shift-left-click).
&9&lNote:&r&l The Oil path is one path towards &9&lEthylene&r&l. The other paths involve getting natural with some Ethanol.&r
For now, Oil is &doptional&r. It becomes mandatory much later when you get to &5EV&r.
Oil can also be refined in the form of &aLight Fuel&r, &aDiesel&r or even &aGasoline&r, which are excellent power options.
If you chose this path, you should use it for both Power and Ethylene.
Oil spouts are a &6great starting point&r - they will tide you over until you unlock Fluid Drilling Rigs.

&l&3Lore:&r&o Oil geysers were originally from Buildcraft. If you played a GregTech 5 modpack &cwithout&f Buildcraft, you needed to use the Fluid Rig and tap randomly to try and get lucky, or wait until &6HV&f, where prospecting for fluids was available.
Ever mined into an Oil deposit?
Any Pump will do
Any Oil bucket
US Simulator
Underground, you may come across pure Oilsands ore veins. You can &3centrifuge&r the Dust to get &aOil&r.
&9&lNote:&r&l The Oil path is one path towards &9&lEthylene&r&l. The other paths involve getting natural with some Ethanol.&r
For now, Oil is &doptional&r. It becomes mandatory much later when you get to &5EV&r.
Oil can also be refined in the form of &aLight Fuel&r, &aDiesel&r or even &aGasoline&r, which are excellent power options.
If you chose this path, you should use it for both Power and Ethylene.
Oilsands are a &6great starting point&r - they'll tide you over until you unlock Fluid Drilling Rigs.
This quest was sponsored by the US Military
Oilsands Ore
America Simulator
Before we start, here's some important information if you're aiming to make Ethylene:
Taking the &aOil&r route will require &oat least&r a &3LV Distillery&r.
With the &aBiomass&r route, you will &lneed&r a &3MV Distillery&r.
Get &eeither&r to complete this quest.
Got all that? &6Alright&r! Let's discuss a complex topic: &9Distillation&r. We'll try to help you understand how and why the &aEMI&r recipes are the way they are, so stick with us.
Nearly all the &3Distillery&r recipes are duplicates from the &3Distillation Tower&r, except that they only have one Fluid output, and void everything else.
In other words, you could argue the &3Distillery&r is an &dinferior&r &3Distillation Tower&r.
This doesn't mean that the &3Distillery&r is the worse of the two. It is unlocked earlier, and it is &dsmaller&r, &dcheaper&r, and &dmore energy efficient&r per recipe.
Hell, in many cases, you won't even mind losing the other Fluids.
&3Distilleries&r are an essential component for power generation, whether you pick &aDiesel&r or &aBenzene&r.
You'll probably want many of them at as low-tier as possible to avoid the energy losses from Overclocking.
The Illusion of Free Choice
Either an LV or MV Distillery
Distillery
&aRefinery Gas&r, &aLPG&r and &aMethane&r are &9Gas Fuels&r. LPG (Liquid Petroleum Gas) is a mix of hydrocarbons typically used in heating appliances.
Refinery Gas is obtained either through &dNatural Gas&r or &dLight Oil&r, the latter yielding more, yet requiring an extra step of distillation.
Use of a &3Centrifuge&r to separate into &aLPG&r and &aMethane&r should always be done, as it's practically free.

&a&aLPG&r and &aMethane&r are burned in a &3Gas Turbine&r. Among the other fuel options, they are the easier to set up which makes them excellent to get started. Their drawback is that they cannot be refined further, so upgrading the &3Fluid Drilling Rig&r may be a top priority if you stick to this fuel source.
&aMethane&r can also be obtained from a few &anatural sources&r. &eBetween us&r, they're memes, but you can explore them if you wish. Ultimately, your power source is your choice.
Whoever smelt it...
The Church of Natural Farts
&aBenzene&r is a &9Gas Fuel&r. To skip some frustration, let's check out the two best ways to obtain it.

The first option is typically &dWood based&r. Put Logs in the &3Pyrolyse Oven&r for &9Wood Tar&r. The Charcoal you obtain can then be processed in &3Extractors&r for even more &9Wood Tar&r, which you &3distill&r for &aBenzene&r.
Your second option is &dHeavy Oil based&r. Put Heavy Oil in a &3Distillery&r for &9Heavy Fuel&r, which you &aseverely steam-crack&r and &3distill&r again for &aBenzene&r.
For information on how to process Oil, check the Light Fuel and Naphtha Quests.
In general, it is better to prioritize placing down more machines (&dparallelisation&r) over overclocking the recipes. That way, you end up losing less energy processing the resources.

&aBenzene&r is burned in a &3Gas Turbine&r. This power source starts weaker than its &eDiesel&r cousin, but gets a big boost when refined to &6Nitrobenzene&r in &6HV&r. Ultimately, your power source is your choice.
In the end, it's always Benzene
The Church of Benzene
Distillating &aOil&r will give you Fuel that you will need to desulfurize.
&aHydrogen Sulfide&r is perfectly &drecycled&r in an &3Electrolyzer&r.
To automate this process, simply place your &3Chemical Reactor&r and your &3Electrolyzer&r next to each other. Be sure to use your &5Screwdriver&r to &4enable input from the output side&r.
&aLight Fuel&r is a good &9Power&r option, but there's something even greater... check the Quest to the left.
Turn up the Lights in here, baby
Light Fuel
&aDiesel&r is a &dOil-based &9Combustion Fuel&r.
To mix &aLight Fuel&r and &aHeavy Fuel&r, the right ratio for &3Distilleries&r is &63:2&r from &dOil&r or &dRaw Oil&r.
This would necessitate 3 Distilleries for Light Fuel, or 2 Distilleries for Heavy Fuel.
You can cut the amount of &dOil&r required &6drastically&r by using &dHeavy Oil&r for &aHeavy Fuel&r specifically. &dOilsands&r is a great option if you wish to go down this route!
&o(For the math nerds, you go from 8.33 Oil -> 6 Diesel, to 5 Oil + 0.4 Heavy Oil -> 6 Diesel)&r

&eNote:&r Do &cnot attempt&r to put Oil in the &3Distillation Tower&r You might think it's a good idea because it gives both Light Fuel and Heavy Fuel. However, this process requires a lot of overclocking to be worth your time, and you will lose more energy than what the byproducts are worth.
In general, it is better to prioritize placing down more machines (&dparallelisation&r) over overclocking the recipes. That way, you end up losing less energy processing the resources.

&aDiesel&r is burned in a &3Combustion Generator&r. It can be further refined to &6Cetane-Boosted Diesel&r in &6HV&r. Compared to the other power sources, it is generally more efficient, but a more demanding processing line. If you take the &eOil&r route for &aPolyethylene&r, this can work great with existing infrastructure. Ultimately, the power source you want to use is your choice.
Mother, how is diesel made?
The Church of Diesel
Regular &o&dGregTech&r Fluid Pipes can only transport one fluid type at a time.
&3Quadruple Fluid Pipes&r can transfer four different types of fluids. &3Nonuple Fluid Pipes&r can transfer nine different types! Useful for compact setups.
&3Nonuple Fluid Pipes&r will be useful in &5EV&r for handling the many outputs of the &3Distillation Tower&r.
Get &eeither&r to finish this quest.
\"I thought channels were disabled!\"
Multiple Channel Potin Pipes, please
Multiple Channel Pipes
Using a Ruby Lens, engrave a Silicon Wafer into an ILC Wafer.
This can be processed in a Cutter for IC Chips, which are important components that will be precious when improving upon your circuit crafting capabilities.
I C U
IC Chips
Using a Sapphire Lens, engrave a Silicon Wafer into an ULPIC Wafer.
This can be processed in a Cutter for ULPIC Chips, which are important for some multiblock components!
Pickin' up Chips
ULPIC Chips
&3Long-Distance Item Pipes&r can be used to send items across great distances. Place one endpoint at each end, and connect them with pipeline blocks.
These pipes instantly transfer from the input side to the output side.
They also have a minimum distance between pipe endpoints, so you can't use these for short-range operations.
Wondering how to move those ores around?
Long-Distance Items
&3Long-Distance Fluid Pipes&r can be used to send fluids across great distances. Place one endpoint at each end, and connect them with pipeline blocks.
These pipes instantly transfer from the input side to the output side.
They also have a minimum distance between pipe endpoints, so you can't use these for short-range operations.
These pipes have a reputation of being &4buggy&r to set up. If they don't seem to work at first, try rotating the endpoints with a &eWrench&r.
Wondering how to move that oil around?
Long-Distance Fluids
Tired of running around your base yet? &3Travel Anchors&r make their introduction in the latest update!

Aim the &aTravel Staff&r at a placed Anchor, then &6sneak-right-click&r to teleport on top. You can &bcustomise the appearance&r of a Travel Anchor by right-clicking it with a block in your off-hand, and you can &9rename&r Anchors in their GUI. The effective tool for breaking them is the &bWrench&r.
The &dEnder Pearls&r necessary to craft more Anchors won't be available yet - take a small handful of Anchors to make life a &olittle&r easier.
pshhh... nothin personnel... kid
Travel Anchors
This Jetpack takes most &aCombustion Fuels&r (excluding oils) to enable a primitive form of flight.
Fill it like you would fill a Drum, or with a &3Canning Machine&r.
Press &4H&r (default) to enable Hover Mode.
...well, almost Fly
I Believe I Can Fly
This jetpack enables flight, and requires energy.
Charge it like you would charge a Battery.
Press &4H&r (default) to enable Hover Mode.
&o&8(Yeah, yeah, a jetpack is supposed to work off \"propellants\". Y'all are always here to nitpick.)&r
...still not quite there.
I Believe I Can Fly II
The &aPortable Scanner&r, or &aTricorder&r, is GTCEu's debug tool.
Using it will show you a block's details, the details of the energy network, its current status and contents, and its impact on performance.
It'll also display a percentage of fluid remaining in the fluid vein for the &3Fluid Rigs&r.
&l&3Lore:&r&o This little useful device comes from GregTech 5. It was extremely useful in the early days, because very little information (basically nothing) was given by GUIs or WAILA.
For the nosiest GregTech players
Tricorder
In this quest, we'll bestow upon you &5cursed wisdom&r... the ability to easily automate the Electrolyzer.

The &9Smart Item Filter&r is a filter that recognises Recipe Maps. When placed on the side of a machine, you can set it to \"&3Electrolyzer&r\" to allow insertion of electrolyzable items specifically. You heard that right - no need to filter manually!
Oh, and it only gets &abetter&r. If you combine this bad boy with a &aRobot Arm&r, it'll only supply the &6exact amount&r of items required for a successful recipe to the machine.
Place the &aRobot Arm&r on your Electrolyzer, open its GUI, then place the &9Smart Filter&r inside. Ensure that the Smart Filter is set to Electrolyzer.

Next, configure it to &d&lImport&r and &d&lSupply Exact&r. Finally, attach any inventory &7(a chest will do)&r onto the side where you placed the &aRobot Arm&r. Ta-dah! You've figured out how to handle &6all&r Electrolyzer recipes!

What about the output of the &3Electrolyzer&r? You may want to route the Fluids to several Tanks - or even &3Super Tanks&r if you've gotten that far. We highly recommend that you avoid any methods involving voiding Fluids.&7.&8. except for Water for obvious reasons.

&9Note:&r The Robot Arm has to facilitate the item transfer for its filtering functionality to work! Inserting directly into the machine &7(for instance, pushing with a Hopper!)&r will ignore the Robot Arm's &dSupply Exact&r setting.
Knock, knock - who's that? It's MENSA!
200IQ
gregtech_modern.mv__medium_voltage.subti: Venture into petrochemistry and refine electronics
gregtech_modern.mv__medium_voltage.title: &bMV&r - Medium Voltage
gregtech_modern.ore_generation.quests0.d: Some of the details are repeated from the introduction quest, but we feel like we needed to expand on the explanation if you want to know all the details!
Each vein can contain up to four different ores.

Ore veins generate in a &4Grid&r. Every vein is spaced by 3 chunks from one to another in a cardinal direction. Each vein generates in an individual \"pattern\" - some are &6round&r, some are &asnakey&r, and others you'll discover for yourself.

They spawn at the &4Center&r of the Chunks which have both their X and Z coordinates be at &b1 plus a multiple of 3&r (-8, -5, -2, 1, 4, 7, ...). You will typically find two veins in the selected chunk - one will be in the Stone layer, and the other vein lays deeper in the Deepslate layer.
However, Ore veins may be deleted by caves, Oil deposits, or from trying to generate above the ground.
It's a good practice to make &dWaypoints&r to every vein you find, and to label their type. You may want to come back to it several times.
A typical Ore vein is &d7 blocks&r tall, and ores generate in 4 different patterns:
- The &9Top Ore&r generates in the higher 4 layers of the vein.
- The &9Bottom Ore&r generates in the lower 3 layers of the vein.
- The &9Between Ore&r generates in the middle 3 layers of the vein.
- The &9Sporadic Ore&r generates anywhere in the vein. There will be the least amount of this ore in a vein.
The same ore type can be in 2 different generation patterns, such as in Cassiterite veins.
gregtech_modern.ore_generation.quests0.s: You'll be an expert by the time you finish reading this!
gregtech_modern.ore_generation.quests1.d: A standard Iron vein. It's a good target when you need to replenish your supply.
gregtech_modern.ore_generation.quests2.d: This vein is namely one of the few direct sources of Gold in the overworld.
There are many other sources of Gold in GregTech, but you will likely see better yields of Gold if you obtain it by processing other resources.
gregtech_modern.ore_generation.quests3.d: Chalcopyrite will play an integral role in the late game, when you're looking to get your hands on some Platinum Group Sludge.
gregtech_modern.ore_generation.quests4.d: A great vein for the early game. Copper and Tin to make Bronze, Realgar for your first source of Arsenic, and Zeolite for... nothing much.
&l&3Lore:&r&o As GregTech used to auto-generate its recipes, Zeolite used to electrolyze in batches of 141 dust at a time. Whoops!
gregtech_modern.ore_generation.quests5.d: A pure, very rich Tin vein - excellent for early game. You'll be over the moon to find one of these in the &6Steam Age&r.
gregtech_modern.ore_generation.quests6.d: A decent alternative to the pure Tin vein if you haven't found one yet.
The other ores are as good as decoration.
gregtech_modern.ore_generation.quests7.d: As an ore, Coal is hardly worth large-scale processing, because there are too many additional steps. required to turn it into usable fuel. It's still good to have some in your back pocket.
Just run it through a Furnace.
gregtech_modern.ore_generation.quests8.d: Diamond has &6five times more durability&r than Iron for tools. The catch is that you'll need Diamond Plates for some tools, which is gated behind the Cutting Machine.
Diamond and Graphite both electrolyze into a ton of Carbon. Hint, hint..?
&cNote:&r Avoid macerating Diamonds in the early game. Recovering gem dusts into the actual gem cannot be done for a while - and even then, the process is slow and time-consuming...
gregtech_modern.ore_generation.quests9.d: Your one-stop-shop for sources of Chlorine.
If you're pining after Lithium, note that it can be obtained from Lepidolite Ore Processing.
gregtech_modern.ore_generation.quests9.s: Source of Salt, Chlorine, Lithium, Fluorine
This vein starts to become notable for its Magnesium output starting in the midgame.
Olivine also has various uses, as it can substitute &aEmerald&r in a couple of recipes.
Yeah, you wish you could make jewelry out of it.
This is pretty much the one vein you want to tap in for Phosphorus - which requires quite a few steps of processing to obtain.
Pyrochlore will eventually become extremely valuable, as it's a good source of Niobium.
Ruby is very important for the Chromium it contains. You'll quickly discover that you can never have too much Chromium!
Source of Redstone, Ruby, Chromium, Mercury
Both Sapphire variants serve as your primary source of Aluminium until you can unlock other electrolysis recipes in &bMV&r.
The other two gems are mediocre at best.
A good source of &6Heavy Oil&r, which is useful for &6Diesel&r setups early on.
If you don't want to spend time processing Oilsands through your setup, you can always just &bCentrifuge&r it directly to get the Heavy Oil.
This one's nothing but a meme. It's literally called a Lubricant vein.
With that being said, Lubricant is always useful for your &eCutting Machines&r to keep your factory running smoothly.
Did you know Lazurite and Sodalite can be used as substitutes for &9Lapis&r in enchanting?
Sodalite is the most valuable Ore here, thanks to its useful electrolysis recipe when you get to &bMV&r.
Source of Lapis Lazuli, Aluminium, Sodium, Chlorine
Pyrolusite is what most people are here for. It smelts directly into Manganese, which you'll be needing in bulk for &6HV&r.
Tantalite will eventually become extremely valuable, thanks to its Niobium byproducts, and its utility when crafting &bSMD Components&r.
The most consistent source of Lead and Silver.
Your one and only trusty source for Nickel.
A source of Bauxite for your first ever Titanium.
Kyanite and Mica decompose into some desirable products if you electrolyze them, but there are definitely better options, so you shouldn't hunt them down if you want their byproducts.
&8(This vein probably irks your average GTNH player...)&r
The worst Iron vein. It's helpful in the early game, but that's about it.
We love you anyway, Mineral Sand vein!
The de-facto Rare Earth vein for progression in &5EV&r... and onwards.
&l&3Lore:&r&o This vein was bugged for quite some time. It's never actually contained any Monazite, and nobody realised (well, nobody brought it up!) for many, many months. Did you notice?
Source of Rare Earth, Neodymium, Fluorine
Emerald is the useful ore here. It's used in small quantities in &bMV&r, and is a part of the Crystal process for Crystal and Wetware circuits much later on.
This vein is very rare! Congratulations on stumbling upon one.
&8(Or at least... it should be rare.)&r
View the contents of this vein as \"&7&obasically Molybdenum, and some other stuff&r\". Yeah, Molybdenum is what's important here.
Your ticket into &bApplied Energistics 2&r is nestled deep within a Certus Quartz vein.
Alongside this, note that Barite electrolyses into Barium, which you will eventually need to make some higher tier Superconductors.
Electrotine is important for progression in &6HV&r. It centrifuges into Electrum (a source of Gold and Silver), and Redstone.
Saltpeter is used in a few reactions, and... the other two ores here are pretty average.
&l&3Lore:&r&o Does the word \"Nikolite\" ring a bell? It's pretty much Electrotine's great-ancestor, hailing from RedPower.
Both Topaz ores are excellent subjects for eventual electrolysis.
This makes this vein one of the best Fluorine sources.
Almost a pure Copper vein. Damn you, Stibnite, ruining our purity!
You can hardly complain about its presence, though - Stibnite smelts directly into Antimony, which you will want in &7LV&r for your Batteries.
This Nether Limonite vein variant isn't to be slept on.
Thanks to the &adoubled yield&r of Nether ores, this is an excellent source of Iron and Gold.
Your first Nether expedition should be for &eSulfur&r - which is found in this vein! Be careful, as this vein usually spawns from y-levels of 10 to 30. Bring Fire Resistance potions!
Sphalerite is extremely valuable, as its ore processing gives Gallium. It also smelts directly into Zinc.
Silicon isn't too difficult to come by, but Quartzite isn't a bad source.
You may already have boatloads of Iron by the time you make it here, but don't overlook the utility of this vein.
Chromite is an excellent source of Chromium, and Vanadium is needed in higher quantities in the late game.
Source of Iron, Vanadium, Gold, Chromium
Seasoned sci-fi fans might recognise &2Naquadah&r from the series &dStargate&r! You'll find this becomes an essential material from &dLuV&r onwards.
Naquadah can be processed in &dLuV&r for Titanium, Trinium, Barium, Gallium, Indium, Phosphorus, Enriched Naquadah, and Naquadria. Versatile!
Moving the spotlight to the other ore, &cPlutonium&r is used to start the Radon loop, required in &9IV&r.
The Platinum Group Sludge chain becomes a requirement in &1IV&r, and Sheldonite is the best ore to kickstart your processing.

&l&3Lore:&r&o The real-world name for Sheldonite ore is actually Cooperite. GregoriusT thought it was \"haha, funny\" to make it a reference to Sheldon Cooper, despite &lnot&r&o being the person the ore was named after!  We kept the \"haha, funny\" joke going.
Your one and only &9Tungsten&r source! Whilst you could technically get your Tungstate from macerating &eEnd Stone,&r the yield is tiny. Process these ores instead!
An extremely important vein, as Tungsten is used in vast amounts in &9IV&r and onwards.
The vein to mine for &bAluminium&r and &dTitanium&r if you're a well-adjusted person.
Ditch those Mica veins - Bauxite is the future!
The one and only vein for Uranium!
Uranium has a few minor uses in &5EV&r and beyond.
Did you know that Nuclear Reactors might be making their way to &bGTCEu&r in the future?
gregtech_modern.ore_generation.subtitle0: Ores galore, and so much more
gregtech_modern.ore_generation.title: Ore Generation
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.quests0.d: All good ore processing lines start with a crush, and in your case, you'll want to macerate either your &5Raw Ore&r, or your Ore blocks (if you're using &dSilk Touch&r!)

When you can make the large multiblock Miners, your ore yield is almost &aquadrupled&r further, and you won't need to macerate for the first step - the &bLarge Miner&r will output its ores as if they had been macerated.
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.quests0.t: I'm feeling pretty crushed right now.
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.quests1.d: Nothing special here. Any ores that you don't wash in novelty chemicals simply need to be washed in water with an &dOre Washer&r. You should use Distilled Water, as it cuts the recipe time down by &650%%&r. Set up a couple of Distilleries on-site and buffer into an appropriately-sized &aSuper Tank&r.
If you don't care about the byproducts in this section, you can wash the ores in &bregular water&r without a configured circuit to process &225x&r faster, but &4without&r byproducts.
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.quests1.t: Nah, I'll go with Distilled Water.
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.quests2.d: Sodium Persulfate isn't as simple to obtain as Mercury, but you'll probably find yourself making some when crafting Circuit Boards. Set up a &6Chemical Reactor&r/&bElectrolyser&r combo with a Level Emitter attached if you want to keep some in stock, and then you can wash any Crushed Ore with a &aChemical Bath&r.
You'll want to use &3Sodium Persulfate&r when processing:
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.quests3.d: Washing ores with Mercury where applicable instead of &3Distilled Water&r grants unique byproducts that may be difficult to obtain in other circumstances. It's usually worth doing this, as Mercury is readily available from centrifuging &cRedstone&r or &4Cinnabar&r &7(and in fact, Mercury is the &lonly&r&7 real usage of Cinnabar!)&r.
Simply wash any &6Crushed Ore&r with a Chemical Bath.
Here is a non-exhaustive list of ores you likely want to wash in Mercury:
These alternate \"&bwashing routes&r\" will increase your Gold, Silver, and Platinum Group yields significantly!
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.quests4.d: The default way to deal with ores at this step is usually with the &eThermal Centrifuge&r for its &bexclusive byproduct&r, but check around the above quest to make sure you're not missing something important.
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.quests5.d: From now onwards, you'll be sending &ball of your ores&r towards &6all kinds of places&r, depending on how far you are through your playthrough. Quests will unlock around this node when you &aunlock the ability&r to deal with them, so check back occasionally if you're feeling bored.
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.quests5.s: Started from the Raw Ore, now we here
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.quests5.t: We've got some Purified Ore - what's next?
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.quests6.d: From now? That's the basics of an &5ore processing setup&r. You can check your filters, make more machines, and generally improve efficiency, but if you've &6loosely&r followed everything on this page, you should be in &bgood stead&r!
&m&7Hopefully, some information here was of use.&r
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.quests6.t: Yay! That was really, really fun.
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.quests7.d: Some Gem ores - namely &cRuby&r, &9Sapphire&r, and &2Green Sapphire&r - can be mixed with Aqua Regia in their crushed form to obtain Slurry.
When electrolysed, the Slurry has some interesting byproducts. Namely, it's one of the few ways to obtain &dTitanium Dust&r without macerating Titanium ingots!
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.quests8.d: Some dusts in &bGregTech&r have little use other than to be processed in an &3Electrolyser&r for some nice bonus chemical outputs. You can either set a manual filter for the desired items in a &aStorage Bus&r, or provide the most vital dusts via ME Interface, for example.
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.quests8.s: We don't need THIS much Cobaltite, right?
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.quests9.d: Some stages listed on this page output Small/Tiny Dusts, or Nuggets. These have little use in such a form, so it's never a bad idea to route these into a &dPacker&r to \"&7compress&r\" them into their full forms.

If you're having problems with the Packer filling up with too few Nuggets and clogging your buffer, then you may want to consider using a &6GregTech Robot Arm&r set to \"Supply Exact\". Send your Nuggets in 9 at a time, and you can consider this a problem solved!
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.quests9.t: Call me Amazon delivery driver the way I be packaging
Gemstones deserve to be sifted. In &2earlier stages&r of the game, this is slow and has poor yields, but when overclocked, sifting quickly becomes a great way to &dmaximise&r your gemstone yield.
As mentioned in the main sections of this quest book, this &5Indium setup&r has a limited lifetime, so don't stress over optimising every last detail.
Simply mix &dPurified Galena&r and &eSphalerite&r together with some &aSulfuric Acid&r to obtain &9Indium Concentrate&r, then combine with Aluminium Dust in a Chemical Reactor for your prize!
Getting your first Indium has never been so fun.
I won't get too attached to my Indium setup.
You'll want to send off the following ores to &aPlatinum Group Processing&r:
Treat these ores with &eNitric Acid&r to receive your &5Platinum Group sludge&r, alongside a Sulfuric byproduct fluid. What you do with these &boutputs&r... is up to you to figure out!
Quite the rabbit hole to jump down...
The Electromagnetic Separator is an interesting machine that skips &6two processing stages&r, but usually returns &2unique&r byproducts that aren't usually too simple to obtain. You'll need to process down pure dusts to use this - so &bmake sure&r you route any desired ores correctly.
You may &bappreciate&r performing this stage of processing on the following ores:
- Bastnasite Ore &7(This is particularly strong for Neodymium!)&r
- Naquadah Ore &7(The Enriched Naquadah byproduct is very powerful!)&r
I'm harnessing the power of magnetism!
Hello! You're probably looking to set up &abasic ore processing&r. This quest line will try to guide you through the necessary motions. As always, it's &6important&r to make the disclaimer that this isn't the only &o\"meta\"&r way to process your ores - a strong ore processing facility will treat each ore depending on the demands of your &bGregTech&r factory. We emphasise that you shouldn't take this guide as gospel.
From one Ore, a great many dusts shall flow...
A side product of sifting is the production of &dpure dusts&r. These shouldn't be sent back to your main storage, because they can't be used in recipes... and &3centrifuging&r them will give you a sweet, sweet extra byproduct.
Fear not! We have our solution!
Never mind, it's not as bad as I thought.
Multiple &don-tier machines&r are never a bad idea, but you should definitely consider using the Large multiblock variants of the singleblock machines from &aGregicality Multiblocks&r. They're significantly easier to upgrade as you progress through the later tiers of the mod (would you rather make a &616A LuV Energy Hatch&r, or &b16 LuV Macerators&r?!), and plus... they look rad as hell.
How would I boost my processing power?
Whilst the majority &7(if not all)&r of the listed steps can be automated &3using GregTech alone&r, savvy players may wish to use &dAE2&r for all their logistics needs. Here, we'll cover some methods you may not be aware of to help you elevate your &aOre Processing&r to the next level.
Let's look at what AE2 can do for you!
The &3ME Tag Storage Bus&r is crucial to send tagged items to a desired destination. It does what it says in the tin - simply set its filter by clicking on it, then any items that enter your AE2 network that &ematch the programmed Item Tag&r will be sent to the inventory attached to the Bus.
This can be particularly useful in the event that you wish to use a &afiltered subnet&r to process ore.
Remember to set a &5high priority&r if you want to prioritise Ore Processing!
One could define a Subnetwork &7(or \"Subnet\" for short)&r as any network that isn't part of your main network.

The simplest way to create a Subnet is by attaching an &bME Interface&r to a &aStorage Bus&r. This means that the Storage Bus will treat the Interface as an inventory to be read from - i.e., it'll be able to see &5all of the items&r in the network connected to the Interface.

As your main network will &4not&r be transferred through the Storage Bus, you'll need to give your subnet power from the main network with &6Quartz Fibre&r. Ensure that you don't accidentally connect the two networks with regular cabling.

Question is - how does this &abenefit you&r as a player? The logistics powers made available with subnetworking are immense, so we'll cover a few examples &9in light detail&r. The rest is left as an exercise to the reader!
- A subnet for your ore processing system, which &bautomatically handles&r all the intermediate byproducts without them constantly entering and exiting your main network!
- Really, it's useful to subnet &dlarger processing chains&r such as &ePlatinum processing&r. This way, you can ensure that byproducts can be appropriately recycled, and reduce overhead.

Subnets can be infinitely nested, but as always in &bmodded Minecraft&r, this should be performed in moderation (or even better, avoided), as many levels of nesting can cause &4performance issues&r when calculating the network.
Oh... and if you've re-enabled Channels in this pack, subnetworks only consume a single channel from your main network. What a bargain!
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.subtitle0: How to extract as much as possible...
gregtech_modern.ore_processing.title: Ore Processing
gregtech_modern.progression.quests0.desc: Early game Circuits are hand craftable.
Pick up the &3Circuit Assembler&r to make them a lot more efficient.
gregtech_modern.progression.quests1.desc: The &9Integrated&r Circuit line may not be a strict upgrade in terms of cost, but will tide you over as a stepping stone towards the next tier.
They will require a MV &3Laser Engraver&r and a MV &3Cutting Machine&r.
&l&3Lore:&r&o In Omnifactory, and in previous Gregicality, this circuit line was called &9Refined&f and was standardized like further tiers.
gregtech_modern.progression.quests2.desc: &eMicro&r Circuits are where the &3Cleanroom&r becomes a requirement to progress.
Don't get caught out by the &aMainframe&r - it requires a &3HV Circuit Assembler&r.
gregtech_modern.progression.quests3.desc: Starting from here, circuit progression will follow a pattern:
gregtech_modern.progression.quests4.desc: You may want to invest in &aPBI&r at this point, as &dAdvanced SMDs&r will skyrocket your circuit production.
gregtech_modern.progression.quests6.desc: It will be the biggest automation challenge to face in this modpack. Best of luck.
gregtech_modern.progression.quests7.desc: On this line you can see the Steam, or &8&8ULV&r, equivalents.
gregtech_modern.progression.quests8.desc: Circuits along this line are &7LV&r, and are interchangeable in recipes.
&cElectronic Circuits&r are the \"worst\" in terms of cost and effort required to produce, but you have to start somewhere.
&eBasic Integrated Processors&r act as a middle layer between &cElectronic Circuits&r and &2Microchip Processors.&r
Finally, &2Microchip Processors&r will be the best option for the rest of the playthrough.
gregtech_modern.progression.quests9.desc: Circuits along this line are &bMV&r, and are interchangeable in recipes.
The pattern stays the same: the rightmost circuit comes in &dlarger quantities&r and is overall &aeasier&r to produce.
gregtech_modern.progression.quests10.des: Circuits along this line are &6HV&r, and are interchangeable in recipes.
The pattern stays the same: the rightmost circuit comes in &dlarger quantities&r and is overall &aeasier&r to produce.
gregtech_modern.progression.quests11.des: Circuits along this line are &5EV&r, and are interchangeable in recipes.
The pattern stays the same: the rightmost circuit comes in &dlarger quantities&r and is overall &aeasier&r to produce.
gregtech_modern.progression.quests12.des: Circuits along this line are &1IV&r, and are interchangeable in recipes.
The pattern stays the same: the rightmost circuit comes in &dlarger quantities&r and is overall &aeasier&r to produce.
gregtech_modern.progression.quests13.des: Circuits along this line are &dLuV&r, and are interchangeable in recipes.
The pattern stays the same: the rightmost circuit comes in &dlarger quantities&r and is overall &aeasier&r to produce.
Make sure to set up &3wetware board production&r as soon as possible! These take a &6very long time&r to make.
gregtech_modern.progression.quests14.des: Circuits along this line are &cZPM&r, and are interchangeable in recipes.
gregtech_modern.progression.quests15.des: Circuits along this line are &3UV&r, and are interchangeable for each other.
gregtech_modern.progression.quests16.des: Congratulations! You've reached the end of the circuit progression.
The only &4UHV&r circuit is the &6Wetware Mainframe&r, which is used for crafting some endgame stuff.
gregtech_modern.progression.subtitle0: A step forward is always rewarding
gregtech_modern.progression.title: Circuit Progression
gregtech_modern.renewability_and_you.que: You may be wondering how to obtain &6large quantities&r of common resources used in &bGregTech&r. This might be old news to seasoned players, but it's actually possible to set up &dpassive processes&r to make various materials and chemicals &2fully renewable&r.
We've added this chapter to lead you towards some setups that you &7&omight&r desire. Obviously, there's no need to do all of these, but who doesn't love &2\"free\" resources&r.

&9&lA footnote:&r There's no way we could document all of the renewable routes in &bGregTech&r. This quest page merely serves as a primer to lead &6newer players&r through their options. Not every option listed in this quest book is optimal, so we urge you to experiment!
Very conscious of you!
I love renewable resources!
Promoting a Sustainable Playthrough
Ah, the Rock Crusher - such an unassuming machine that initially appears to only really be a builder's best friend. Who could look past infinite Cobblestone, Deepslate, or Obsidian?

Don't be fooled, though, as this little machine might just shock you with the array of materials it makes renewable when you macerate its rocks down to dust form. The surrounding quests will clue you in.
More like game breaking, am I right?
Rock Breaking
Cobblestone is just the start of things. Let's make a Cobbleworks!
Oh, we're only just getting started.
Cobblestone
The Joy of Cobblestone
&6Stone Dust&r can be centrifuged in &bMV&r for a wide range of miscellaneous materials. It's a slow and expensive process, but you may wish to check it out.
Obviously, Quartzite is Quartzite. Did you know that you could extract any excess Quartzite into &eLiquid Glass&r?
&aPotassium Feldspar&r electrolyses into some incredibly useful resources.
You also have a (low) chance for &dBiotite&r, which notably electrolyses for a very slow source of &bFluorine&r.
Finally, &aMetal Mixture dust&r is useless until you can centrifuge it at &5EV&r. Pretty much all of its outputs when centrifuged are very useful.
Small Stone, Big Byproducts
Just Forge Hammer that Cobblestone and you'll get some &dGravel&r.
Gravel macerates into &6Stone Dust&r, but with a low chance of Flint when the recipe is performed in a &6HV Macerator&r or above. You probably want to sift for Flint, anyway!
Flint Dust centrifuges into &aSilicon Dioxide&r, which is then electrolysed for Silicon and Oxygen.
cp_gravelpit
Yet another &bForge Hammer&r step, but you'll be making &dSand&r renewably. With renewable Sand comes renewable Glass (remember to try using an &9Arc Furnace&r for that sweet &adoubled&r yield!).
Quartz Sand Dust centrifuges into a chanced output of &3Certus Quartz&r Dust.
Two vast and trunkless legs of stone...
Yup - &brenewable&r Glass.
Glass'll always be useful throughout your playthrough in a variety of recipes.
Glass Hurts, doesn't it...
Pulverise your Diorite into Dust, then centrifuge for Mirabilite Dust and Clay Dust.
Mirabilite yields minimal Sulfur, but Clay Dust is the real treasure here. When electrolysed, you'll get some Aluminium for your troubles. Not bad!
Mirabilite, Clay...
Granite Dust centrifuges into Redrock Dust and the familiar Silicon Dioxide Dust.
Silicon Dioxide is generally just great to have, and Redrock centrifuges into Calcite (that's renewable Calcium) and Flint.
Redrock, Silicon Dioxide...
Deepslate centrifuges into... you guessed it... Silicon Dioxide! You may want to set this up for the guaranteed Biotite output, as Biotite electrolyses into Fluorine.
This is obviously a far better source of Biotite than Stone Dust. Hopefully, you didn't waste your time setting that up!
Silicon Dioxide, Fluorine...
Andesite Dust will get you some delicious Asbestos Dust, and some Saltpeter Dust to boot.
Asbestos is a slow source of Magnesium, and Saltpeter has a variety of uses in chemistry.
Asbestos, Saltpeter... (No Create)
By placing some Redstone Dust into your Rock Breaker, you'll find yourself making some Obsidian.
Obsidian Dust is quite useful, as it electrolyses into Iron.
Fallout: New Vegas, Iron...
Basalt Dust centrifuges into Olivine, a material which can be used to substitute Emerald in a small handful of recipes - for example, when making Engraved Crystal Chips.
You also get a pittance of Dark Ash.
Olivine, Dark Ashes...
Not to be confused with regular Granite, Red Granite has some useful utility when the dust is processed.
Electrolysing it yields Aluminium for slightly fewer steps than the renewable Clay electrolysis.
Aluminium...
Marble Dust isn't anything to write home about, yielding Calcite and Magnesium.
Calcite, Magnesium...
By collecting Air with a &6Gas Collector&r and cooling it to Liquid state with a &3Vacuum Freezer&r, you can then distill the liquid Air for a plethora of valuable resources.

You thought that was all? Air collection isn't limited to the &2Overworld&r - whilst you'll require a higher-tier Distillation Tower to distill the \"higher\" tiers of liquid Air, you can also process air from the &4Nether&r and the &5End&r. This process is mostly optional, but you'll definitely find it to be a rewarding one.
Things are up in the air right now...
Air truly is wonderful.
All Kinds Of Air (Distillation)

&5Ender Air&r is probably the most interesting of the three airs to distill. Requiring an &9IV Distillation Tower&r and distilling in batches of 200,000L, you'll need to outfit your DT with at least an &9IV&r Input Hatch (or an &5ME Hatch&r if you're inclined).

You're getting a ton of Nitrogen, Oxygen, Helium, and Deuterium - the latter of which is commonly used in &aFusion&r. Tritium is used to make &6Helium Plasma&r, which is commonly agreed to be the best plasma for &2power generation&r.

Krypton and Xenon are your run-of-the-mill &aEBF-boosting&r Noble gases. At this point, you should consider running most (if not all) of your EBF recipes on &bCircuit 2&r to benefit from the faster durations.
Would you look at that - you get &dRadon&r as well! It's a slow process, especially when you consider that your old setup (did you set it up?) already loops on itself, but &dmore Radon&r is nice.

Last but not least, you're getting a low chance of &3Ender Pearl Dust&r. The chances are low enough that you shouldn't give up on the Mixer recipe just yet... but once again, more &3Ender Pearls&r are nice!
Nitrogen, Oxygen, Helium, Krypton, Xenon, Radon, Ender Pearls...
I'm surprised I can breathe in the End.
Liquid Ender Air
This was touched upon in the &5EV&r chapter, but we'll focus on what this distillation gets you here.

The Nitrogen output is &bsubstantial&r, and can help you keep any &ePyrolyse Ovens&r running. You should buffer some of the Nitrogen so you can &aboost your EBFs&r - faster recipe times save your sanity and energy in equal measures.
Helium and Argon yields are low, but ideally you can run the Air Distillation as a &dpassive process&r every so often to keep your supplies topped up. Both are used to &aboost EBF speeds&r.
&bCrushed Ice&r is... well, &bCrushed Ice&r. Maybe you could open a cocktail bar?
Nitrogen, Helium, Argon....
I promise I won't sell my air as a commodity!
Liquid Air
Carbon Monoxide is useful when making &6Butyraldehyde&r for your Laminated Glass in &9late IV&r.
&6Coal Gas&r can be processed in a Distillation Tower for a variety of useful outputs.
Helium-3 is only used in &bFusion&r, and Neon is used to boost a single &aBlast Furnace&r recipe - &4UHV&r superconductors!
Ashes are always useful for the handful of resources they grant.
Carbon, Coal Gas, Helium-3...
It's not all hellish in the Nether.
Liquid Nether Air

Just so you're aware - vanilla farms such as &7Iron Golems&r or &ePiglins&r have been &4disabled&r in this pack. There are obviously ways to cheese the pack (such as some good old Minecraft &acapitalism&r, &mif you catch our drift&r), but we encourage you to try to play without taking advantage of some notorious vanilla \"&ocheese&r\".

It's possible that in the future, we'll just make a core-mod for the pack, so players can re-enable the disabled mob drops. For now, the drops are disabled via &5KubeJS script&r, so if you're script-savvy, the file can be removed at &o&7server_scripts/vanilla/loot_drops.js&r.
Is it safe? Is it alright?
Oh, darn. That kinda sucks.
What about my mob farm?
gregtech_modern.steam_age.quests0.descri: You may recall that regular Steam machines had a duration penalty, and were twice as slow. Not great.
&5High Pressure&r Steam machines no longer bear a &bduration penalty &rfor recipes, making them objective upgrades.
Make &eone&r of the proposed HP machines to complete this quest.
gregtech_modern.steam_age.quests0.tasks0: Look at all these HP machines...
gregtech_modern.steam_age.quests0.title: No More Penalty
gregtech_modern.steam_age.quests1.descri: Now that you have Steel, you can make a Hang Glider. This might be a good item to grab before you hit up the &cNether&r.
If you don't have enough Leather yet, make a &9Butchering Knife&r and employ its inherent Looting III to hunt some cows.
